byline.original: By BARBARA NATTERSON-HOROWITZ and KATHRYN BOWERS

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by cardiology Prof Barbara Natterson-Horowitz and author Kathryn Bowers, adapted from their book Zoobiquity: What Animals Can Teach Us About Health and the Science of Healing, highlights the commonalities between humans and other animals; outlines what these commonalities, which they have observed by working with veterinarians, could mean for the treatment of human illnesses.
docs.lead_paragraph: Seeing too much of ourselves in other animals might not be the problem we think it is. Underappreciating our own animal natures may be the greater limitation.
docs.snippet: Seeing too much of ourselves in other animals might not be the problem we think it is. Underappreciating our own animal natures may be the greater limitation.

headline.seo: How Do You Put a Nation on a Diet?
headline.print_headline: How Do You Put A Nation on a Diet?
headline.main: How Do You Put a Nation on a Diet?

docs.abstract: Editorial observes that according to an Institute of Medicine report released in May, a major cut in obesity rates will require multiple strategies on a population-wide scale; contends that the nation does not have a choice in the matter if it wants to protect the public health, the strength of the economy and the budget.
docs.lead_paragraph: While obesity has often been seen as a personal failure, experts increasingly point to societal factors and the need for nationwide remedies.
docs.snippet: While obesity has often been seen as a personal failure, experts increasingly point to societal factors and the need for nationwide remedies.

headline.print_headline: French Women Worry About Getting Fat, Too
headline.main: French Women Worry About Getting Fat, Too

docs.abstract: American diet company Jenny Craig is attempting to attract French consumers to its weight-loss program, and faces an uphill battle trying to convince a country proud of its cuisine to embrace its regimen of individually portioned, packaged foods; the company sees an opening because the French are increasingly worried about the obesity rate in their country.
docs.lead_paragraph: An American diet company is trying to convince the French that portion-controlled boeuf bourguignon is not just another assault on their culture.
docs.snippet: An American diet company is trying to convince the French that portion-controlled boeuf bourguignon is not just another assault on their culture.

headline.main: Q. and A. with U.S. National Team Defender Oguchi Onyewu

docs.abstract: An interview with defender Oguchi Onyewu, who talks about playing for his country and for Sporting Lisbon, his motivation to appear in a third World Cup in 2014 and why his family likes to joke about his soccer career.
docs.snippet: An interview with defender Oguchi Onyewu, who talks about playing for his country and for Sporting Lisbon, his motivation to appear in a third World Cup in 2014 and why his family likes to joke about his soccer career.
